questions.text: All of the following statements are true regarding ‘Bipolar disorders’, except?

options.label: A
options.text: Bipolar 1 is having equal prevalence in males and females and bipolar 2 is more common in females

options.label: C
options.text: More common in age group of 35-45 years

questions.correct_answer: C. More common in age group of 35-45 years
questions.explanation:
Solution:

More common in age group of 35-45 years The age of onset for bipolar type I disorder ranges from children of age 5 or 6 years to adults of age 50 years or older; with a mean age of 18 years. The mean age of onset for bipolar type II is 20 years.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option A - Bipolar type 1 disorder has an equal prevalence among men and women. The lifetime prevalence of bipolar type 1 disorder is 0 to 2.4%, while that of bipolar type 2 disorder is 0.3-4.8%. Option B - Suicide attempt is seen in around 15% of people with bipolar disorder. Option D: The prevalence of bipolar disorder is estimated to be around 1%, which is a true statement.

Extraedge:

It is important to differentiate between bipolar disorder and major depressive disorder, as the treatment approaches differ. Lithium is a commonly used medication for the pharmacological management of bipolar disorder.

questions.text: A 40 years old male with history of alcohol intake for many years developed liver cirrhosis, his liver profile shows GGT 563 U/L, AST 180 U/L, ALT 150 U/L. now he has stopped taking alcohol. Which of the following is most suitable drug to be given to him to avoid withdrawal symptoms?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Lorazepam Lorazepam is the most suitable drug to be given to the patient to avoid withdrawal symptoms after stopping alcohol intake.

Highyeild:

Benzodiazepines are the preferred choice for alcohol withdrawal, with short-acting benzodiazepines like lorazepam being preferred. Thiamine administration is important in the treatment of alcohol withdrawal. Carbamazepine (CBZ) can also be used in alcohol withdrawal as has Short half-life and duration of detoxification is of 7-14 days.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option B. Diazepam: Although diazepam is used to relieve symptoms of anxiety and alcohol withdrawal, it is not the preferred choice in this case. Option C. Clonazepam: Clonazepam is primarily used to control seizures or fits due to epilepsy and is not the preferred choice for alcohol withdrawal. Option D. Alprazolam: Alprazolam is used to treat anxiety disorders and panic disorder but is not the drug of choice for alcohol withdrawal.

Extraedge:

Advantages of using short acting BZD: No active metabolites No hangover Safe in elderly Safe in liver failure eg Oxozepam, Lorazepam, Temazepam, Estozolam.

questions.text: Eye movements of sleep stages were recorded by performing polysomnography. Which sleep stage in the given part of the graph represents?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

REM Here, the image shows EOG activity in zone A, EEG activity in zone B, EMG activity in zone C. The area marked in red is characteristic of changes seen in REM phase of sleep, since: Zone A shows positive activity (EOG) Zone B shows mixed wave activity (EEG) Zone C shows very minimal activity (EMG)

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option B - NREM 1 The low-voltage fast EEG pattern of wakefulness gradually gives way to slower frequencies, as NREM sleep goes from stage N1 (decrease in alpha) to stage N2 (spindles, K-complexes) to stage N3 (increasing amplitude and regularity of delta rhythm). Option C - NREM 2 Stage II is the predominant sleep stage during a normal night's sleep. The distinct and principal EEG criterion to establish stage II sleep is the appearance of sleep spindles or K complexes . The presence of sleep spindles is necessary and sufficient to define stage II sleep. Option D - NREM 3 This is a period of deep sleep where any noises or activity in the environment may fail to wake the sleeping person. During this deep sleep stage, your body starts its physical repairs.
